Interesting, so the expression is symmetric around n = -0.5? Because plugging in n and -n-1 gives the same result. Let me check that. text: So, cubes mod6 are congruent to x mod6. Interesting, so x³ ≡x mod6. Therefore, x³ -7 ≡x -7 mod6. So x -7 ≡ 0 mod6, since the left side must be divisible by 6. Therefore, x ≡7 mod6, so x≡1 mod6 (since 7 mod6 is 1). Therefore, x must be congruent to 1 mod6. So x=6k+1 for some integer k.
